channel.title: Landfill Methane Outreach Program (LMOP)
channel.description: Updated Landfill Methane Outreach Program (LMOP) content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: LMOP Special Session
item.description:
The Landfill Methane Outreach Program (LMOP) is pleased to announce that we are collaborating with the Solid Waste Association of North America (SWANA) to organize a panel in conjunction with their upcoming 40th Annual Landfill Gas and Biogas Symposium in Reno, Nevada. The LMOP National Landfill Gas Energy Special Session (LMOP Special Session) will be held from 2:00 to 4:00 pm on Wednesday, March 29, 2017 at the Reno Convention Center. The LMOP Special Session will feature presentations on landfill gas (LFG) energy projects as well as current trends affecting LFG energy development and the solid waste management sector.

Learn more about SWANA's Landfill Gas and Biogas Symposium 2017 » Exit

LMOP is not hosting a separate conference in 2017.

Preliminary Event Details

LMOP Special Session Agenda

The agenda for the LMOP Special Session is currently being developed. Details will be posted here as they are available.

Registration

Online registration for the LMOP Special Session will be managed through the SWANA website. There is no cost to attend the LMOP Special Session, but registration is required. Please visit SWANA's website Exit for more information.

Hotel Information

Please visit SWANA's website Exit for more information.

Exhibit Opportunities

Exhibit opportunities are available for SWANA's Landfill Gas and Biogas Symposium. LMOP is not hosting a separate exhibit area. Please visit SWANA's website Exit for more information.

Additional information about the LMOP Special Session will be available shortly.

If you have any questions, please contact LMOP through our website at https://www.epa.gov/lmop/forms/contact-us-question-about-lmop-special-session.
item.dc:creator: terry_anderson

item.title: Landfill Methane Outreach Program Listserv Messages
item.description:

Sign up to receive LMOP listserv messages.

LMOP periodically notifies interested stakeholders about pertinent landfill-related information via its listserv. See below for recent listserv messages.

item.title: Resources for Partners of the Landfill Methane Outreach Program
item.description:
LMOP Partners can access additional resources:

  • Posters and Flyers - Design options and example posters and flyers for ribbon-cutting or groundbreaking events.
  • PowerPoint Files - Presentation template slides for download and use by Partners presenting about landfill gas energy.
  • LMOP Logo - The LMOP logo is available for use by Partners only, within the guidelines.

To receive any of these resources, please submit this contact form including a note in the Comments/Questions box regarding the specific resource needed.
item.dc:creator: jeanette.alvis@erg.com

item.title: Landfill Gas Energy Project Development Handbook Files
item.description:
The LFG Energy Project Development Handbook (PDH) is organized into several chapters that address various aspects of LFG energy projects. The complete PDH or individual chapters can be viewed or downloaded below.

If you have difficulty accessing or obtaining the information from these PDF documents, please contact LMOP.

  • Complete LFG Energy Project Development Handbook (PDF)(94 pp, 6 MB)
    Updated September 2016
  • Front Materials (PDF)(8 pp, 811 K)
    Updated September 2016
  • Introduction (PDF)(2 pp, 252 K)
    Updated September 2016
  • Chapter 1. Landfill Gas Energy Basics (PDF)(16 pp, 2 MB)
    Updated September 2016
  • Chapter 2. Landfill Gas Modeling (PDF)(6 pp, 797 K)
    Updated September 2016
  • Chapter 3. Project Technology Options (PDF)(17 pp, 2 MB)
    Updated September 2016
  • Chapter 4. Project Economics and Financing (PDF)(18 pp, 1 MB)
    Updated September 2016
  • Chapter 5. Landfill Gas Contracts and Permitting (PDF)(12 pp, 790 K)
    Updated September 2016
  • Chapter 6. Evaluating and Working with Project Partners (PDF)(12 pp, 720 K)
    Updated September 2016
item.dc:creator: bo_zaks

item.title: Research and Analyze Landfill Gas Energy
item.description:
LMOP provides a variety of resources to assist stakeholders seeking to learn more about landfill gas (LFG) energy project development, in the process of developing a project, or anywhere in between. Three resources are listed here, with additional items available at Publications, Tools and Resources.

  • Project Development Handbook (PDH) - Provides an overview of LFG energy project development guidance and multiple considerations that affect the feasibility of a successful project.
  • LFGcost-Web - LMOP's economic cost estimation model can be used to provide an initial economic feasibility analysis for an LFG energy project.
  • Regulations Affecting Landfills or LFG - LMOP offers a basic reference sheet listing regulations that affect landfills or LFG energy projects, with Web addresses for readers interested in more information.
item.dc:creator: jeanette.alvis@erg.com

item.title: Access Project and Landfill Data
item.description:
LMOP provides technical data for landfill gas (LFG) energy projects and landfills to a wide range of organizations and individuals who request this type of information.

  • LFG Energy Project Data - Find and use spreadsheets of key LFG energy project data such as operational status, start date, project size, and technology type, as well as project case studies.
  • Landfill Technical Data - View or download pertinent landfill data such as location, operational status, design capacity, and gas collection system status.
  • Data by State - Access project and landfill data at the state level and see project and candidate landfill counts by state on the LMOP national map.
item.dc:creator: jeanette.alvis@erg.com

item.title: Engage with the Landfill Methane Outreach Program
item.description:
LMOP provides assistance in creating partnerships and networking opportunities with peers and landfill gas (LFG) energy experts.

  • Join the Program - A variety of organizations involved in the U.S. LFG industry have joined in partnership with LMOP in five categories: Industry, Energy, Community, State and Endorser. Partnership with LMOP benefits the Partner as well as the Program.
  • LMOP Listserv - LMOP periodically notifies interested stakeholders about pertinent information via the program's listserv and archives the messages on its website.
  • Connect with LMOP Partners - Review the existing LMOP partnership network – for example, search for an equipment supplier or service provider, see which utilities are buying electricity from LFG or check out which communities across the country are turning their LFG into an asset.
item.dc:creator: bo_zaks

item.title: Learn about Landfill Gas
item.description:
LMOP provides information about landfill gas (LFG) and LFG energy projects to a wide range of organizations and individuals interested in this important topic.

  • Landfill Gas - LFG is composed of about 50 percent methane, a greenhouse gas with a global warming potential at least 25 times greater than that of carbon dioxide (CO2).
  • Benefits of LFG Energy - Beneficially using LFG is one of the best ways to achieve a near-term impact in reducing landfill methane emissions.
  • Frequent Questions - Learn more about the Program, LFG and LFG energy projects, and some of the health and environmental concerns related to LFG.
item.dc:creator: jeanette.alvis@erg.com
